subject: Sleep
title: Sleep in Shakespeare
description: A fast breakdown of Sleep in Shakespeare for builders.

hook.text: Sleep that knits up the raveled sleeve of care. Shakespeare understood sleep's healing power 400 years before neuroscience.

buildup.text: Macbeth murders sleep itself along with the king. The play treats sleeplessness as a divine punishment for guilt.

discovery.text: Shakespeare references sleep over 300 times across his plays, using it as a metaphor for innocence, death, and peace.

twist.text: Lady Macbeth's sleepwalking scene is one of the earliest literary depictions of a parasomnia linked to psychological guilt.

climax.text: Shakespeare's intuition about sleep and mental health aligns remarkably with modern psychiatry.

punchline.text: Shakespeare wrote about sleep like a scientist who happened to use poetry.

quiz.question: How does Macbeth portray sleeplessness?
options: As a divine punishment for guilt
As completely irrelevant to the story
